intro: Gymnadenia rubra, commonly known as the red gentian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are typically tubular and arranged in a loose cluster. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Gymnadenia rubra has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and can grow up to 30 centimeters in height. It blooms during the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
